title: All types dialog shows obfuscated classes
description: The Open Type dialog in JDK 1.4 displays obfuscated classes (e.g., 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd') instead of the expected non-obfuscated classes.
OB: Obfuscated classes are prominently visible in the Open Type dialog.
EB: The Open Type dialog should only display non-obfuscated classes.
SR:
1. Launch the application using JDK 1.4.
2. Open the Open Type dialog.
3. Observe that obfuscated classes (e.g., 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd') are displayed instead of non-obfuscated classes.
